intro: Byrsonima angustifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or sour apple, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically sour and contain a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and disturbed areas. The tree is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
